page.title: 18Recreation - Two Bridges
page.content:
Over 850 letterboxes are hidden on Dartmoor, this area containing 16 of them.
Each box (an old ammunition or ice cream container) is the home of a visitors book and a rubber stamp and stamp pad; visitors usually sign the book and keep a copy of the stamp for their collection.
The boxes are well hidden, requiring clues and compass bearings to find them, and provide a great deal of enjoyment for many walkers.
Those with over 100 boxes visited to their credit can join the unusual{ {Dartmoor Letterboxes 100 Club}who meet at the Forest Inn at Hexworthy twice a year, when the clocks "change"!
